# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the code for your function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_")
end
```

This function first converts all uppercase letters to lowercase using the `lowercase` function, and then it removes leading and trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Then, it replaces all spaces with underscores using the `replace` function. The result will be a clean column name ready for use in your Julia code.
